statement: AT&T, founded in 1875 as Bell Telephone Company, is planning to shut down its copper network in the US, a move that will impact landline phone service in 20 states, including Wisconsin. The move to ditch copper lines is part of AT&T's effort to transition to a wireless-only network, with only 1.3% of Americans still relying solely on landlines. The company had previously planned to make the change by 2020 but pushed it back due to the complexity of the process.
introduction: AT&T is planning to shut down its copper network in 20 US states, including Wisconsin, as part of its transition to a wireless-only network, impacting landline phone service in those areas.

statement: Merck, a pharmaceutical company, has announced that its Phase 3 KEYLYNK-001 trial met its primary endpoint, evaluating KEYTRUDA (pembrolizumab) plus chemotherapy followed by maintenance with LYNPARZA (olaparib) in patients with BRCA non-mutated advanced epithelial ovarian cancer. Additionally, Merck received a positive EU regulatory opinion for Welireg as a treatment for von Hippel-Lindau disease and advanced kidney cancer. The company also reported positive results from a trial combining Keytruda and Lynparza, and announced a 100% complete response rate for its investigational antibody-drug conjugate in patients with diffuse large B cell lymphoma.
introduction: Merck announced positive trial results for its cancer treatments, including KEYTRUDA and LYNPARZA, and received a positive EU regulatory opinion for Welireg, a treatment for von Hippel-Lindau disease and advanced kidney cancer.
